Height in Tailwind CSS

Notes on Height Utilities

Tailwind CSS provides a set of height utilities that allow you to control the height of elements easily. These utilities use the h- prefix followed by a size value. Heights can be fixed (e.g., pixels), relative (e.g., percentages), or responsive. Common uses include setting container heights, creating consistent layouts, and ensuring elements fit within specific dimensions.

  • Fixed Heights: Use classes like h-4 (1rem), h-8 (2rem), up to h-96 (24rem).
  • Relative Heights: h-full (100%), h-screen (100vh), h-1/2 (50%), etc.
  • Auto and Min/Max: h-auto, min-h-full, max-h-64.

Syntax Examples

Fixed Height

h-24

Sets height to 6rem (96px).

Full Height

h-full

Sets height to 100% of parent.

Screen Height

h-screen

Sets height to 100vh (full viewport height).

Fractional Height

h-1/2

Sets height to 50% of parent.
